alert.note: Alert for Northwest Suffolk (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 12:38PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Suffolk County through 130 PM EDT... At 1238 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Brentwood, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Commack, Hauppauge, Smithtown, Nesconset and St. James. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
